title: py-config
text:
Installation
The package is not yet available on PyPI, but you can install it from GitHub:
pip install git+https://github.com/andrie/py-config
Tip: add this to your requirements.txt file:
config @ git+https://github.com/andrie/py-config
And then use pip install -r requirements.txt to install the package.

title: Reference
text:
Functions to manage your configuration.



config_get
Get a value from the config.yaml file.

title: Reference
text:
Functions to manage your configuration.



config_get
Get a value from the config.yaml file.

title: User Guide
text:
Given this config.yaml file:
default:
  trials: 5
  dataset: "data-sampled.csv"
  
production:
  trials: 30
  dataset: "data.csv"
You can read the config file:

import config.core as config


config.config_get('trials')

5



config.config_get('trials', 'production')

30

title: config
text: The config package makes it easy to manage environment specific configuration values. For example, you might want to use distinct values for development, testing, and production environments.

title: config
text:
Installation
The package is not yet available on PyPI, but you can install it from GitHub:
pip install git+https://github.com/andrie/py-config
Tip: add this to your requirements.txt file:
config @ git+https://github.com/andrie/py-config
And then use pip install -r requirements.txt to install the package.

title: config
text:
How to use
Given this config.yaml file:
default:
  trials: 5
  dataset: "data-sampled.csv"
  
production:
  trials: 30
  dataset: "data.csv"
You can read the config file:

import config


config.config_get('trials')

5



config.config_get('trials', 'production')

30

title: config_get
text:
config_get(value=None, py_config_active=None, file='config.yaml', encoding=None)
Get a value from the config.yaml file.
Read from the currently active configuration, retrieving either a single named value or all values as a list.











Name
Type
Description
Default




value
str
Name of value (None to read all values)
None


py_config_active
str
Name of configuration to read from. Defaults to the value of the R_CONFIG_ACTIVE environment variable (“default” if the variable does not exist).
None


file
str
Configuration file to read from.
'config.yaml'


encoding
str
Encoding to use when reading the file. Defaults to “utf-8”.
None

title: py-config
text:
config includes the following core features:

get_config() to read a configuration yaml file
